title: Competitive Fund Program: PiDAQ
description: PiDAQ (Polines IoT Data Acquisition), IoT-based industrial data acquisition module using industrial internet of things (IIoT) technology.

title: Smart Glasses for the Blind With Proximity Sensors and GPS Based on the Internet Of Things
description: Innovative auxiliary tool for the blind that can be monitored through a device so that it can be petrified and keep users from hitting objects in front of them.

title: Line Follower
description: Designed and implemented an autonomous line-following robot using infrared sensors and Arduino microcontroller. The system was programmed to detect and follow a predefined path accurately, with real-time motor control based on sensor feedback. This project enhanced my skills in embedded systems, sensor integration, and basic robotics.

title: IoT-based Hydroponic Monitoring
description: Provides accurate monitoring of environmental parameters such as humidity, temperature, soil pH, and nutrients, which are crucial for hydroponic plant growth.

title: Power Supply Current Amplifier Circuit
description: Developed a current amplifier circuit for a DC power supply using transistor-based configuration to increase current output capability. Designed to support higher load currents while maintaining stable voltage levels, this project improved my understanding of power electronics, and transistor biasing.
